column4: when i do modprobe ndiswrapper, i first get a segmentation fault, then when i try again it doesn't work at alle... just no response from the terminal until i press ctrl c
any idea what the problem might be?
this could easily be that the driver is incompatible...is it a bcm4318??
i've used the same driver before
other than that it could be an irq conflict as well
i just did a reinstall
and now it doesn't work
have you added any new device or memory??
don't think so
ah a sound card
hmmm..
lsusb stops working aswell after i get the fault
jolliyo: I had a similar problem when adding memory to my system...it just point blank freaked out when enabling ndiswrapper....due to irq conflict...another person had the same issue.
see comment above...that is what I can think of for now...
jolliy0: does dmesg complain about anything or /var/log/messages?
ok thanks
i'll try it out some more when i get home from work
and no dmesg doesn't complain about anythinng
when you said it worked before...that was in linux right...or are you referring to before as in windows or something??
it's the exact same installation as i have now
installed ubuntu from the same cd
I have a suggestion...maybe starting deactivating or unplugging other devices and try it again...maybe you can isolate a conflict??
